info.name: Substantia gelatinosa
info.description: Substantia gelatinosa is the area of gray matter at the dorsal aspect of the dorsal or posterior horn at all levels of the spinal cord. It corresponds to Rexed's lamina II. It derives its name from freshly-sectioned spinal cord where it appears pale due to its relative lack of myelinated nerve fibers. In conjunction with Lissauer's tract, it deals with afferent pain and temperature information and the modulation of that input by the descending raphe spinal tract. Note that it becomes essentially continuous with the trigeminal spinal nucleus in the transition from spinal cord to medulla.
